hero.title: FAQs & Training Rules
hero.subtitle: Confirm boundaries, process, and risk awareness before you start.
hero.risk: Risk notice: This platform is for learning and training only and does not constitute investment advice.

items.q: How long is the training cycle?
items.a: Typically 30-60 days for the core cycle, adjusted by execution progress.

items.q: How much time per week is needed?
items.a: Set a fixed weekly schedule for structure mapping and reviews to keep continuity.
Weekly review submissions are audited for structure, execution, and results.
Yes. We recommend documenting the reason and a return plan for smoother re-entry.
Execution consistency, review quality, and risk discipline matter more than a single result.

items.q: Is there a coach or leader review?
items.a: Yes. A responsible reviewer follows your cadence and gives structured feedback.
No. Any promise of returns is unreliable. We provide training methods and rules only.
Position rules, stop discipline, and review audits keep risk visible and traceable.
Traders looking for signals or unwilling to record and review are not a fit.

items.q: What happens if rules are broken?
items.a: Violations are logged and reviewed. Repeated issues may pause training.
Core principles stay stable while cases and details iterate with the market.
No. The focus is building your framework, rules, and execution consistency.
We only collect what is necessary and use access control to protect data.

items.q: Can I customize my learning path?
items.a: Yes. You can adjust the order while respecting the core rules.

cta.title: Ready to start your training path?
cta.lead: Share your background and goals. We will propose a cadence that fits your situation.
cta.note: Reminder: Training focuses on process and review, not profit promises.
